    • Constructor Detail

      • TabManager

        public TabManager(IRCClientFrame prnt)
        Constructor for the Tabmanager. creates GUI and adds the initial tab for server communication.
        Parameters:
        prnt -

    • Method Detail

      • setConnection

        public void setConnection(IRCConnection ourConnection)
        Sets connection. Uses the connection to set name of server and nick.
        Parameters:
        ourConnection -

      • getConnection

        public IRCConnection getConnection()
        Returns:
        connection associated with this tab manager.

      • distributeMessage

        public void distributeMessage(java.lang.String prefix,
                     java.lang.String command,
                     java.lang.String alias,
                     java.lang.String server,
                     java.lang.String message)
        Function that distributes messages to appropriate tabs.
        Parameters:
        message - containing a message.
        command - containing a code.
        alias -
        prefix - containing the servername
        server - The servername as received by the message

      • someoneQuit

        public void someoneQuit(java.lang.String nick,
               java.lang.String message)
        Someone other than us quit a channel we are a member of. This command from the server does not tell us which channel the user did quit from, so we have to find the right chan(s).
        Parameters:
        nick - Nickname of the user who quit.
        message - This might be an empty string, timeout message, or something the user wrote himself.

      • closeAllTabs

        public void closeAllTabs()
        Closing all tabs, called when we type QUIT. The quit-command handles leaving the channels, so we just have to close the tabs here.

      • updateChannel

        public void updateChannel(java.lang.String msg,
                 java.lang.String prefix,
                 java.lang.String command,
                 java.lang.String trgt)
        Some updates have occurred on the channel, and these changes must be shown to the user.
        Parameters:
        msg - - the channel where there has been changes.
        prefix - - a string where the first part is the nick of a user. (Or for a MODE-event, the new mode, and the nick of the target.)
        command - - this will include a JOIN/PART or MODE -string.

      • updateOnKick

        public void updateOnKick(java.lang.String chan,
                java.lang.String sender,
                java.lang.String target,
                java.lang.String restMessage)
        Does basically the same as the previous method, but some more other variables and information are needed when a kick occurs. So that the variable-names makes sense, we created a new method.
        Parameters:
        chan - - Name of the channel the where the kick appeared.
        sender - - Who did kick someone.
        target - - Who was kicked, might have been us.
        restMessage - - If there was any reason for the kick.

      • setChannelNames

        public void setChannelNames(java.lang.String chanName)
        Used to send the result of the NAMES-command to a specific tab.
        Parameters:
        chanName - - The name of the channel this NAMES-command belongs to.

      • createChannelNameString

        public void createChannelNameString(java.lang.String names)
        Used for putting all occasions of the /names-command for one channel together. If it`s many users on the channel, the string including the names is splitted in multiple messages.
        Parameters:
        names - A string containing users on a channel

      • distributeChannel

        public void distributeChannel(java.lang.String prefix,
                     java.lang.String chanName,
                     java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.Boolean incoming)
        Function that takes care of distributing messages to the right channeltab. Goes through all the channelTabs to find the channel with the name that this message is meant for. At this point, the channel will always exist in the Vector.
        Parameters:
        chanName - Name of the channel where the message shall be displayed.
        message - The message to display in a channelwindow.
        prefix -

      • checkForNewChannel

        public void checkForNewChannel(java.lang.String message)
        When a message starting with 'JOIN' is written in the textfield, we send the text to his place, to check if a tab with that channelname already exists. If it does, we set this channel to focus, if it doesn`t exists, we create a tab with that name.
        Parameters:
        message - Message, starting with 'JOIN #'.

      • checkToLeaveChannel

        public void checkToLeaveChannel(java.lang.String outText)
        When a 'PART #'-message is issued, we end up here to see if the user has joined this channel at all. If the channelTab is open, we close it, if not, the server sends a 'no such nick' message.
        Parameters:
        outText - The text the user entered in the write-field.

      • checkPersonalTabs

        public void checkPersonalTabs(java.lang.String receiver,
                     java.lang.String message,
                     java.lang.Boolean incoming)
        When an incoming or outgoing message appears here, we want to check if the personalTab already exists or not. If it doesn`t exist, we creates it, and sends the message to it.
        Parameters:
        receiver - This is the nick of the user communicating on the tab.
        message - This is the message to be shown.
        incoming - True if the message is incoming, false if it was sent from our write-field.

      • createPersonalTab

        public void createPersonalTab(java.lang.String tabName)
        Used when our user doubleclick a user on a channel. A personalTab with this user is made, or set to focus.
        Parameters:
        tabName - The username of the user we want to communicate with, and also used as tabName.

      • writeToLn

        public void writeToLn(java.lang.String msg)
        Static function that takes the string parameter and sends to connection and its writeln function.
        Parameters:
        msg - message to be sent to the server.

      • isInit

        public java.lang.Boolean isInit()
        Function that checks if this is a tabManager that has not been initiated.

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Method closes connection and the parent window. only allows closing of the window if it has been initated.

      • getConnectionState

        public int getConnectionState()
        Return state variable of IRCConnection
        Returns:
        connection state

      • closeTab

        public void closeTab(java.lang.String filter)
        Method deletes the contents of tab and calls releaseTab to remove it from tabManager.
        Parameters:
        filter - The filter text of the tab to be closed

      • releaseTab

        public void releaseTab(java.lang.String tabName)
        Removes tab from the tabManager. Does not delete content of tab.
        Parameters:
        tabName - Filter text of tab to be removed.

      • attachTab

        public void attachTab(java.lang.String tabName,
             GenericTab newTab)
        Method attaches a tab to the tabManager and sets focus on the added tab
        Parameters:
        tabName - Filter text for the new tab
        newTab - The tab to be attached to the tabManager

      • getNick

        public java.lang.String getNick()

      • getServer

        public java.lang.String getServer()

      • resizeTabs

        public void resizeTabs(int newHeight)
        Method changes dimension for all tabs
        Parameters:
        newHeight - The new height of the IRCClientFrame
